metadata.dc:author: Castillo Domínguez, J C
Vallés Belsué, F
Mesa Rubio, M D
Siles Rubio, J R
Ramírez Moreno, A
Anguita Sánchez, M
metadata.dc:description: We report a case of an aortic endocarditis caused by Enterococcus faecium in a 34 year old patient diagnosed with ulcerative colitis. A Doppler echocardiogram showed an anterior mitral valve leaflet aneurysm, which made surgery necessary. Mitral valve leaflet aneurysm is a rare, though well-known complication of aortic valve endocarditis which can eventually perforate.
metadata.dc:title: Aneurisma de la valva anterior mitral en un caso de endocarditis aórtica en un paciente diagnosticado de colitis ulcerosa.
[Aneurysm of the anterior mitral valve in a case of aortic endocarditis in a patient with ulcerative colitis].
